DataElement.preferredName: Tumor Identifier Domain Disease Progression Radiograph Image Appearance Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Description of the appearance of recurrent disease/progressive disease as seen on radiographic images.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Tumor Identifier Domain Disease Progression Radiograph Image Appearance Type
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A domain that represents the data that uniquely identifies tumors._The worsening of a disease over time._An image produced on a radiosensitive surface by x-ray radiation that has penetrated and passed through a structure._Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic._The outward or visible aspect of a person or thing._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A domain that represents the data that uniquely identifies tumors.

Concepts.definition: A domain that represents the data that uniquely identifies tumors.

Property.preferredName: Disease Progression Radiograph Image Appearance Type
Property.preferredDefinition: The worsening of a disease over time.:An image produced on a radiosensitive surface by x-ray radiation that has penetrated and passed through a structure.:Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic.:The outward or visible aspect of a person or thing.:Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

Concepts.definition: A process that manifests as the worsening of a disease over time.
An image produced on a radiosensitive surface by x-ray radiation that has penetrated and passed through a structure.
Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic.
The outward or visible aspect of a person or thing.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An image produced on a radiosensitive surface by x-ray radiation that has penetrated and passed through a structure._Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic._The outward or visible aspect of a person or thing._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A condition that differs from the usual physical or mental state.: A magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) pulse sequence that uses an inversion recovery technique to null fluids present in the imaging area, improving clarity of the object of interest.

Concepts.definition: A condition that differs from the usual physical or mental state.
A magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) pulse sequence that uses an inversion recovery technique to null fluids present in the imaging area, improving clarity of the object of interest.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: To improve the quality of something; make better or more attractive.: Substances administered during imaging procedures that allows delineation of internal structures. Contrast agents appear opaque due to the difference in absorption of X-rays or other electromagnetic waves and surrounding tissue.

Concepts.definition: To improve the quality of something; make better or more attractive.

Substances administered during imaging procedures that allows delineation of internal structures. Contrast agents appear opaque due to the difference in absorption of X-rays or other electromagnetic waves and surrounding tissue.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The process of the diffusion or accumulation in a tissue or cells of a substance not normal to it or in amounts above normal. (NCI): A magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) pulse sequence that uses an inversion recovery technique to null fluids present in the imaging area, improving clarity of the object of interest.

Concepts.definition: The process of the diffusion or accumulation in a tissue or cells of a substance not normal to it or in amounts above normal. (NCI)
A magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) pulse sequence that uses an inversion recovery technique to null fluids present in the imaging area, improving clarity of the object of interest.
A small lump, swelling or collection of tissue.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.: To improve the quality of something; make better or more attractive.: Substances administered during imaging procedures that allows delineation of internal structures. Contrast agents appear opaque due to the difference in absorption of X-rays or other electromagnetic waves and surrounding tissue.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
To improve the quality of something; make better or more attractive.

Substances administered during imaging procedures that allows delineation of internal structures. Contrast agents appear opaque due to the difference in absorption of X-rays or other electromagnetic waves and surrounding tissue.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
